thread.title: Jaden Smith: 'I feel it's an honor' to be called crazy
thread.title_full: Jaden Smith: 'I feel it's an honor' to be called crazy | Newsday

author: newsday.com
title: Jaden Smith: 'I feel it's an honor' to be called crazy
text:
No one will ever accuse Jaden Smith of giving a boring interview. In his chat with GQ magazine, Smith is all about saying why he thinks it's amazing to be called crazy.
"It's the best thing. People think you're crazy -- I feel like it's an honor, actually, for people to think I'm crazy," Smith said. "Because they thought Galileo was crazy, too, you know what I'm saying? I don't think I'm as revolutionary as Galileo, but I don't think I'm not as revolutionary as Galileo."
He also said that 10 years from now, he has no idea where he'll be or what he might be doing. "No one will know where I am in 10 years. They'll see me pop up, but they'll be like, 'Where'd you come from?' No one will know," he said.
Jenner eyes movies
Kylie Jenner is ready for her close-up. In an update to her official website and app, Jenner said that she and her mother, Kris Jenner, are working to turn her into the next big movie star, The Daily Mail reports.
In a post on her website, Jenner wrote, "Just got off the phone with my mom," then added that they were talking "about a movie script."
This was also Jenner's first update to her site and app since brother-in-law Lamar Odom's near-fatal ordeal last week when he was found unconscious in a Las Vegas brothel.
